abstract.p: Dan Casner letter says FreeNet performs same encryption function as Pulius but in a more decentralized way, hence decreasing chances of information being censored (July 27 article)

block.p: ''Divided Data Can Elude the Censor,'' about Publius, a system that encrypts and divides messages to make it harder for someone other than the intended recipient to reconstruct the message, missed one important point. Publius, while useful, is not a new concept. FreeNet (freenet.sourceforge.net) does the same thing but in a more decentralized way, hence decreasing the chances of the information being censored. FreeNet is also an open-source system, which lets third parties modify it and deal with any bugs.
